meanings.def: used when the man or boy who performs an action is also affected by it
examples: Peter ought to be ashamed of himself.

meanings.def: used to emphasize the male subject or object of a sentence
examples: Did you see the manager himself?

meanings.def: to be in a normal state of health or happiness
examples: He didn't seem quite himself this morning.
He needed space to be himself.
He managed to repair the car by himself.

meanings.def: for only him to have or use; not shared
examples: He has the house to himself during the week.

idioms.def: to be in a normal state of health or happiness
examples: He didn't seem quite himself this morning.
He needed space to be himself.
He managed to repair the car by himself.

idioms.def: for only him to have or use; not shared
examples: He has the house to himself during the week.

related: bring out of himself, herself, etc.
bring somebody out of himself, herself, etc.
